A homophone is a word that is pronounced the same as another word but differs 
in meaning, and may differ in spelling. The words may be spelled the same, such 
as rose (flower) and rose (past tense of "rise"), or differently, such as carat, caret, 
and carrot, or to, ... In some accents, various sounds have merged in that they are 
no longer...
